concepts.title: Adaptation in Plants
concepts.content: Adaptation is the gradual change in the body parts and behavior of organisms which help them to survive, breed, and maintain their existence in a particular environment. For example, desert plants have thorns instead of leaves to reduce water loss.

examples.text: Aquatic plants: Waxy layer on leaves
Desert plants: Deep roots, fleshy stems
Snowy regions: Conical shape to shed snow

keyPoints: Adaptation is not a sudden process; it takes thousands of years
Plants in snowy regions are conical to prevent snow accumulation
Lotus stalks are hollow and flexible to survive in water
concepts.funFact: The world's largest flower, Rafflesia, is found in the jungles of Indonesia and is a parasitic plant!
